DataElement.preferredName: Abdominal Radiology Patient SGOT Upper Limit of Normal Eligibility Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator for patient eligibility to verify that an image of the abdomen was completed if serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase (SGOT) was greater than the upper limit of normal.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Abdominal Radiology Patient SGOT Upper Limit of Normal Eligibility
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to abdominal radiology and the upper limit of normal for serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase (SGOT) in patient eligibility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.:The use of radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.
The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: SGOT (AST) Upper Limit of Normal Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: DesignNote: Urea Cycle, Tricarboxylic Acid Cycle, Transamination:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: DesignNote: Urea Cycle, Tricarboxylic Acid Cycle, Transamination
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
